p: Eighty-eight of all patients had a positive initial chest CT. On the other hand, of all 1014 patients, only 601 (59%) had positive RT-PCR results. In these patients, the chest CT was positive in almost all cases (97%). In those patients who had negative RT-PCR result, chest CT was positive in 75%. If the authors considered the RT-PCR as a gold standard, the sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of chest CT indicating COVID-19 infection were 97%, 25%, and 68%, respectively.
